    • Method Detail

      • addStat

        protected void addStat(Stat stat)
        Start supporting this type of statistic. Replaces any existing statistic that has the same type. This method is only to be used by subclasses.
        Parameters:
        stat - - the statistic to add

      • setStatPercentage

        public void setStatPercentage(StatType type,
                     double percentage)
                       throws MissingStatException
        Sets the remaining percentage of the stat. If possible, it is recommended that you use StatEffect instead.
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of stat
        percentage - - the percentage
        Throws:
        MissingStatException - - if this entity does not support the stat

      • getStatValue

        public double getStatValue(StatType type)
                    throws MissingStatException
        Helper method that returns getStatPercentage() * getStatMaxValue()
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of statistic
        Returns:
        double - the remaining value of the statistic
        Throws:
        MissingStatException

      • getStatPercentage

        public double getStatPercentage(StatType type)
                         throws MissingStatException
        Description copied from interface: HasStats
        Returns the remaining percentage value of the statistic. Percentages must be greater than or equal to 0.0. Percentages above 1.0 represent temporary boosts above the maximum value. Throws a MissingStatException in the event that this class does not support a certain statistic. Use the hasStat method to check that a statistic is supported before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        getStatPercentage in interface HasStats
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of statistic
        Returns:
        double - the remaining value of the statistic
        Throws:
        MissingStatException

      • getStatMaxValue

        public double getStatMaxValue(StatType type)
                       throws MissingStatException
        Description copied from interface: HasStats
        Returns the 'maximum' value of the statistic. The maximum value must be greater than or equal to 0.0. It is possible to go over the maximum value by setting the stat percentage to a value greater than 1.0. Percentages above 1.0 represent temporary boosts above the maximum value. Throws a MissingStatException in the event that this class does not support a certain statistic. Use the hasStat method to check that a statistic is supported before calling this method.
        Specified by:
        getStatMaxValue in interface HasStats
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of statistic
        Returns:
        double - the maximum value of the statistic
        Throws:
        MissingStatException

      • hasStat

        public boolean hasStat(StatType type)
        Description copied from interface: HasStats
        Returns whether this statistic is supported i.e. does this stat entity have the given StatType. Use this method before calling getStatPercentage and getStatMaxValue to prevent MissingStatExceptions being throw.
        Specified by:
        hasStat in interface HasStats
        Parameters:
        type - - the type of statistic
        Returns:
        boolean - true iff this statistic is supported

      • onTick

        public void onTick(long stepSize)
        Description copied from class: WorldEntity
        This function is called for every game tick.
        Overrides:
        onTick in class WorldEntity

      • applyEffect

        public boolean applyEffect(StatEffect effect)
        Description copied from interface: HasStats
        Applies an effect to any applicable statistics. Objects that implement this interface should generally pass this effect to all statistics and let the statistic implementation determine whether it should handle the effect or not. The effect.getType() method may not be sufficient to determine which statistics can handle it.
        Specified by:
        applyEffect in interface HasStats
        Parameters:
        effect - - the effect to apply
        Returns:
        successful - true iff the effect was applied.

      • addStatListener

        public void addStatListener(StatListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: HasStats
        Adds a stat listener. The listener will be notified when a StatEvent occurs.
        Specified by:
        addStatListener in interface HasStats
        Parameters:
        listener - - the stat listener

      • removeStatListener

        public void removeStatListener(StatListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: HasStats
        Removes a stat listener. The listener will no longer be notified when a StatEvent occurs
        Specified by:
        removeStatListener in interface HasStats
        Parameters:
        listener - - the stat listener
